candidates.title: Update `teloxide-core` `0.4.5` -> `0.5.0`
candidates.body: uwu

candidates.title: Remove the need for `CacheMe` in dispatcher
candidates.body:
<!--
Before making this PR, please ensure the following:

 - The PR is open to `dev`, NOT `master`.
 - `CHANGELOG.md` is updated (if necessary).
 - Documentation and tests are updated (if necessary).
-->
Doesn't change anything for users, just an internal cleanup.

candidates.title: Release `0.7.3`
candidates.body:
Prepare a `0.7.3` release with updated `teloxide-core` to bring in the [security fix].

[security fix]: https://github.com/teloxide/teloxide-core/pull/200

candidates.title: Implement `teloxide::handler!`
candidates.body: Resolves https://github.com/teloxide/teloxide/issues/567.

candidates.title: Document and test all command renaming rules
Built-in webhook support
candidates.body: Add built-in support for webhooks

candidates.title: Refactor `BotCommand` trait & related stuff
candidates.body:
1. Rename `BotCommand` -> `BotCommands`
2. Implement  #531 (closes #531)
3. Some unrelated documentation/test/readme/changelog fixes

Note that this PR also requires changes from https://github.com/teloxide/teloxide-macros/pull/15

candidates.title: Merge `examples/sqlite_remember.rs` with `redis_remember.rs`
candidates.body: Closes https://github.com/teloxide/teloxide/issues/504.

candidates.title: Fix compilation with non-default features
candidates.body:
When introducing dispatching v2 we've somehow lost the fact that `repl`s require `ctrlc_handler`, so without default features the compilation failed. Basically we've reintroduced issue #462.

Also we've introduced a similar bug with `cache-me` feature that is required by `dispatching2` feature but wasn't declared as such.

candidates.title: Release v0.6.0
candidates.body: `cargo publish --dry-run` performs well.

candidates.title: Post dispatching2
cleanup update listeners docs
candidates.body:
- Cleanup `update_listeners` docs - Clarify `StatefulListener` docs a little For reference, the diagram looks like this:
Big picture

![2022-01-25_20-28](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38225716/151029719-e174de0a-2259-4809-9ed3-64d4b98f6f12.png)

candidates.title: Update `teloxide-core` to the latest git version
candidates.body: This, among over things, allows to test fixes made in `teloxide-core` since the last release

candidates.title: Remove the `authors` field from `Cargo.toml`
candidates.body: See https://github.com/teloxide/teloxide-core/pull/148#issuecomment-998751346.

candidates.title: crates.io no longer shows badges
candidates.body:
[crates.io](https://crates.io) previously displayed badges next to a crate on its website, but that functionality has been removed. Packages should place badges in its README file which will be displayed on [crates.io](https://crates.io) (see [the `readme` field](https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/manifest.html#the-readme-field)).

From note at [Cargo Manifest Format](https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/manifest.html#the-badges-section)

candidates.title: Dispatching 2.0
Add example using the InlineKeyboardMarkup
candidates.body:
Hi all :wave: 

This is an example of how you can use the `InlineKeyboardMarkup` to create a more complex bot with buttons and callbacks to handle those clicks.﻿

candidates.title: Add `auto-send` to the list of default features
candidates.body: We use this feature in basically every example and we expect everyone to use it, so I think it should be on by default. Also, users had problems b/c they forgot to turn it on.

candidates.title: Depend on a right `futures` version
candidates.body: Currently, users are having problems because of older `futures` versions locked in their `Cargo.lock`.

candidates.title: Include inline bot example
candidates.body:
Hello :wave: 

I started using your library to develop a bot that requires inline functionality. I found #207 but also found that the example given there wasn't compiling, so I poked around until I was able to come up with something that did.

Hopefully this is helpful and that I didn't miss anything obvious in the contributions guidelines.
